source.model.im_drive¶

This module contains continuous-time models for an induction motor drive.

Peak-valued complex space vectors are used. The space vector models are implemented in stator coordinates.

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

InductionMotorDrive

Interconnect the subsystems of an induction motor drive.

InductionMotor

Induction motor.

SaturationModel

Magnetic saturation model.

SaturatedInductionMotor

Induction motor with main-flux saturation.

Datalogger

Datalogger for an induction motor drive.

DriveWithDiodeBridge

Induction motor drive equipped with a diode bridge.

DataloggerExtended

Datalogger for an induction motor drive with a diode bridge.
class source.model.im_drive.InductionMotorDrive(pars)[source]¶

Interconnect the subsystems of an induction motor drive.

This interconnects the subsystems of an induction motor drive and provides the interface to the solver. More complicated systems could be simulated using a similar template.

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

class source.model.im_drive.InductionMotor(pars)[source]¶

Induction motor.

An induction motor is modeled using the Gamma-equivalent model [1]. The model is implemented in stator coordinates.

Parameters

pars (ModelData object) – Contains the system model data.

R_s¶

Stator resistance.

Type

float

R_r¶

Rotor resistance.

Type

float

L_ell¶

Leakage inductance.

Type

float

L_s¶

Stator inductance.

Type

float

p¶

Number of pole pairs.

Type

int

psi_ss0¶

Initial value of the stator flux linkage.

Type

complex

psi_rs0¶

Initial value of the rotor flux linkage.

Type

complex

Notes

The Gamma model is chosen here since it can be extended with the magnetic saturation model in a staightforward manner. If the magnetic saturation is omitted, the Gamma model is mathematically identical to the inverse-Gamma and T models. For model transformation, see [1].

References

1(1,2)

Slemon, “Modelling of induction machines for electric drives,” IEEE Trans. Ind. Appl., 1989, https://doi.org/10.1109/28.44251.

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

Compute the stator and rotor currents.

tau_M – Electromagnetic torque.

Return type

f(self, psi_ss, psi_rs, u_ss, w_M)[source]¶

Compute the state derivatives.

Parameters

  • psi_ss (complex) – Stator flux linkage.

  • psi_rs (complex) – Rotor flux linkage.

  • i_ss (complex) – Stator current.

  • i_rs (complex) – Rotor current.

  • u_ss (complex) – Stator voltage.

  • w_M (float) – Rotor angular speed (in mechanical rad/s).

Returns

Time derivative of the state vector, [dpsi_ss, dpsi_rs]

Return type

complex list, length 2

meas_currents(self)[source]¶

Measure the phase currents at the end of the sampling period.

Returns

i_s_abc – Phase currents.

Return type

3-tuple of floats

class source.model.im_drive.SaturationModel(pars)[source]¶

Magnetic saturation model.

Magnetic saturation is modeled using the power function:

L_s(psi_s) = L_su/(1 + (beta*abs(psi_s)**S)
L_su¶

Unsaturatad stator inductance.

beta¶

Positive coefficient.

Type

float

S¶

Positive coefficient.

Type

float

References

Qu, Ranta, Hinkkanen, Luomi, “Loss-minimizing flux level control of induction motor drives,” IEEE Trans. Ind. Appl., 2021, https://doi.org/10.1109/TIA.2012.2190818

parsModelData object

Contains the system model data.

__call__(self, psi_s)[source]¶
Parameters

psi_s (complex) – Stator flux linkage.

Returns

L_s – Instantaneous saturated stator inductance.

Return type

float

class source.model.im_drive.DriveWithDiodeBridge(pars)[source]¶

Bases: source.model.im_drive.InductionMotorDrive

Induction motor drive equipped with a diode bridge.

This models an induction motor drive, equipped with a three-phase diode bridge fed from stiff supply voltages. The DC bus has an inductor and a capacitor.

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.
